Nature: The immovable property as per Schedules A and B below was acquired by Merugu Manjulata, wife of the 1st of us and mother of the 2nd and 3rd of us, during their lifetime, on 29.03.2011, from Rangarao, son of Kandagatla (late) Venkaiah, resident of Vijayawada, and a sale deed was registered in the name of the said Merugu Manjulata, and the sale deed was registered in the office of the Sub-Registrar, Patamata, in Book 1, Deed No. 1723/2011, the immovable property as per the below Schedule A and B has been transferred to the said Merugu Manjulata, who has paid all taxes etc. relating to the said property in the name of the said Merugu Manjulata, and has been enjoying the said property with all its full possession and all its rights and interests without any written arrangements being made in this regard on 29.05.2023. After their death, as we are the heirs according to the law of inheritance, the said property has been inherited by us, we have taken possession of it, paid all taxes, etc. related to the said property, and are enjoying our full possession and all rights in it, indisputably, jointly and severally with all the beneficiaries. In such a situation, since we are not getting an income worth the value of the immovable property listed in Schedules A and B, which has been inherited by us as stated above, and for the welfare and profit of our family, we are in need of money and have made efforts to sell the property listed in Schedules A and B. Since you have asked for a higher rate than all those who have asked, we have fully agreed to them and have sold the property listed in Schedules A and B to you for a sum of Rs. 21,75,000/- (Twenty One Lakh Seventy Five Thousand Rupees in words). The said purchase money has been paid by you in cash as an advance of Rs. 2,00,000/-(Two lakhs in characters) at the time of signing this sale agreement, which has been received by you. Further, the remaining purchase consideration of Rs. 19,75,000/-(Nine lakhs seventy five thousand rupees in characters) shall be paid within 45 days from this date and the proper purchase deed shall be registered by me in your name or in the name of your nominee. In case you fail to pay the remaining purchase money by the above date, then interest at the rate of 100% per month from the date of payment shall be charged. You will pay us the remaining purchase price with interest at the rate of Rs. 2/-.
If you are ready with the remaining purchase price and ask us to register, and we delay in registering, then you will pay us the remaining purchase price, after deducting the interest at the above rate on the advance money you have given us until we come and register, from the remaining purchase price that you have to pay us.
We have fully convinced you that we have not made any other encumbrances, i.e. purchase agreements, purchases, deed, mortgages, leases, etc., to anyone else, and we have given you this final sale agreement in your name on this day.
The entire amount payable for the said purchase price shall be the property of the Panchayat / Municipality, Revenue etc. taxes
If there are any dues, we will pay them all and give you the receipts.
I will be able to provide you with all the original and photocopy copies of the Scheduled Property by the time of registration. And arrange to bring EC etc.

Nature: The immovable property as per Schedules A and B below was acquired by Merugu Manjulata, wife of the 1st of us and mother of the 2nd and 3rd of us, during their lifetime, on 29.03.2011, from Rangarao, son of Kandagatla (late) Venkaiah, resident of Vijayawada, and a sale deed was registered in the name of the said Merugu Manjulata, and the sale deed was registered in the office of the Sub-Registrar, Patamata, in Book 1, Deed No. 1723/2011, the immovable property as per the below Schedule A and B has been transferred to the said Merugu Manjulata, who has paid all taxes etc. relating to the said property in the name of the said Merugu Manjulata, and has been enjoying the said property with all its full possession and all its rights and interests without any written arrangements being made in this regard on 29.05.2023. After their death, as we are the heirs according to the law of inheritance, the said property has been inherited by us, we have taken possession of it, paid all taxes, etc. related to the said property, and are enjoying our full possession and all rights in it, indisputably, jointly and severally with all the beneficiaries. In such a situation, since we are not getting an income worth the value of the immovable property listed in Schedules A and B, which has been inherited by us as stated above, and for the welfare and profit of our family, we are in need of money and have made efforts to sell the property listed in Schedules A and B. Since you have asked for a higher rate than all those who have asked, we have fully agreed to them and have sold the property listed in Schedules A and B to you for a sum of Rs. 21,75,000/- (Twenty One Lakh Seventy Five Thousand Rupees in words). The said purchase money has been paid by you in cash as an advance of Rs. 2,00,000/-(Two lakhs in characters) at the time of signing this sale agreement, which has been received by you. Further, the remaining purchase consideration of Rs. 19,75,000/-(Nine lakhs seventy five thousand rupees in characters) shall be paid within 45 days from this date and the proper purchase deed shall be registered by me in your name or in the name of your nominee. In case you fail to pay the remaining purchase money by the above date, then interest at the rate of 100% per month from the date of payment shall be charged. You will pay us the remaining purchase price with interest at the rate of Rs. 2/-.
If you are ready with the remaining purchase price and ask us to register, and we delay in registering, then you will pay us the remaining purchase price, after deducting the interest at the above rate on the advance money you have given us until we come and register, from the remaining purchase price that you have to pay us.
We have fully convinced you that we have not made any other encumbrances, i.e. purchase agreements, purchases, deed, mortgages, leases, etc., to anyone else, and we have given you this final sale agreement in your name on this day.
The entire amount payable for the said purchase price shall be the property of the Panchayat / Municipality, Revenue etc. taxes
If there are any dues, we will pay them all and give you the receipts.
I will be able to provide you with all the original and photocopy copies of the Scheduled Property by the time of registration. And arrange to bring EC etc.

sections.content: The property covered under Sale Deed No. 1723 of 2011, dated 29-Mar-2011, executed by Kandagatla Rangarao & Kandagatla Annapurna in favour of Merugu Manjulatha. Schedule-A: The property admeasuring an extent of 41 Sq.Yds., UDS out of 310.33 Sq. Yds., bearing plot. no. 21, comprised in survey number 19/2A, 19/3A, 20/3, and 20/5A, revised as L.P. No. 354/80 and thereafter revised as L.P. No. 7/81, situated in Kanuru Gram Panchayat Area & Village Taluk, within the District of Krishna registered at sub-registrar office Patamata is bounded as follows: North by: Plot No. 20 (73.06 Feet) South by: Plot No. 22 (73.06 Feet) East by: Plot No. 32 (38.0 Feet) West by: 33.0 Feets wide road (38.0 Feet) Schedule-B The property admeasuring an extent of 41 Sq. Yds., with a plinth area of 675.00 square feet, together with 100.0 square feet of common area and 23.0 square feet of parking area, being an incomplete flat, comprised in Re-Survey Nos. 19/2A, 19/3A, 20/3 and 20/5A, revised as L.P. No. 354/80 and subsequently revised as L.P. No. 7/81, bearing Flat No. SF-2, situated on the Second Floor of the RCC residential apartment complex known as “Shri Maruti Enclave,” consisting of Ground, First and Second Floors, constructed on the land described in the A-Schedule, located at Kanuru Gram Panchayat Area and Kanuru Village, within Vijayawada Registration District, Krishna District, and within the jurisdiction of the Sub-Registrar Office, Patamata, is bounded as follows: North by: Joint Passage South by: Open to sky East by: Flat.no.SF-3, Junnu Venkateswara Rao. West by: Stair Case and Flat No.SF-1. Schedule as per AOS: The property admeasuring an extent of 41 Sq. Yds., with a plinth area of 675.00 square feet, together with 100.0 square feet of common area and 23.0 square feet of parking area, bearing House Number 19-674 in Flat No. SF-2, situated on the Second Floor of the RCC residential apartment complex known as “Shri Maruti Enclave,” consisting of Ground, First and Second Floors, constructed on the land described in the A-Schedule, located at Kanuru Gram Panchayat Area and Kanuru Village, within Vijayawada Registration District, Krishna District, and within the jurisdiction of the Sub-Registrar Office, Patamata, is bounded as follows: North by: Joint Passage South by: Open to sky East by: Flat.no.SF-3, Junnu Venkateswara Rao. West by: Stair Case and Flat No.SF-1.

As per Registered Documents: 1. The property in comprised in survey number 19/2A, 19/3A, 20/3, and 20/5A, situated in Kanuru Village measuring about 310 Sq. Yds., was originally owned by Kodali Venkateswarlu, who acquired the property through Sale Deed vide Doc.No. 2344 of 1982. [Ref: Deed] 2. The aforementioned, Kodali Venkateswarlu executed a Agreement of Sale Cum GPA, on 06/Mar/2007, registered as document No. 1184 of 2007, before the SRO Patamata, favour of Yedupati Vengayya & Reddy Bathinaranjaneyulu, towards the property measuring 310 Sq. Yds., comprised in survey number 19/2A, 19/3A, 20/3, and 20/5A, situated in Kanuru Village. 3. The aforementioned Kodali Venkateswarlu Rep. by his GPA Agent's 1. Yadupati Vengaiah, 2. Reddy battina Ramanjaneyulu and 3. Yadupati Vengaiah, 4. Reddibattina Ramanjaneyulu executed a Sale Deed, on 03/Dec/2007, registered as document No. 5414 of 2007, before the SRO Patamata in favour of Naraharisetty Rajendra Kumar, towards the property measuring 310 Sq. Yds., comprised in survey number 19/2A, 19/3A, 20/3, and 20/5A, situated in Kanuru Village. 4. The aforementioned Naraharisetty Rajendra Kumar executed a Sale Deed on 25/Sep/2009, registered as document No. 3476 of 2009, before the SRO Patamata, favour of Kandagatla Ranga Rao & Kandagatla Annapurna, towards the property measuring 310 Sq. Yds., comprised in survey number 19/2A, 19/3A, 20/3, and 20/5A, situated in Kanuru Village. 5. The aforementioned Kandagatla Ranga Rao & Kandagatla Annapurna, executed a Sale Deed, on 29/Mar/2011, registered as document No. 1723 of 2011, before the SRO Patamata, favour of Merugu Manjulatha, towards the property measuring 41 Sq. Yds., bearing plot. no. 21, comprised in survey number 19/2A, 19/3A, 20/3, and 20/5A, situated in Kanuru Village. 6. The aforementioned Merugu Manjulatha executed a Mortgage Deed on 31/Mar/2011, registered as document No. 1796 of 2011, before the SRO Patamata, in favour of M/S Sundaram BNP Paribas Home Finanve Limited Vijayawada, towards the property measuring 41 Sq. Yds., situated in Kanuru Village. Note: It is to noted that three mortgages have been created against the property under Document Nos. 1796 of 2011, is currently active with M/S Sundaram BNP Paribas Home Finanve Limited Vijayawada. Upon inquiry with the F.I., they reverted to release a conditional report. Therefore, it is advisable to obtain a Receipt Deed before proceeding with the loan disbursement. 7. Thereupon, the said Merugu Manjulatha died intestate on 29/May/2023, as evidenced by the Death Certificate issued by Municipal Cooperation Vijayawada, vide Registration No. D-2023: 28-90032-002985, dated 07-Jun-2023 , leaving behind 1. Merugu Prakash Rao(Husband), 2. Merugu Navya( Daughter) & 3.. Merugu Nikhilesh(Son) as his family members, as evidenced by the Family Member Certificate issued by the Andhra Pradesh Government, Gram ward Sachivalayam vide No. FAMC012303423446, dated 11/Aug/2023. 8. Thereupon, the said 1. Merugu Prakash Rao, 2.Merugu Navya & 3. Merugu Nikhilesh executed an Agreement of Sale (Un-Registered) dated 24/Jan/2026, in favour of Garikipati Neeharika for the sale of the property admeasuring an extent of 41 Sq. Yds., [Part of Pledging Deed - To be Executed] Note: It is to be noted that the Sale Deed is to be executed within 45 days from the date of execution of this AOS, hence, F.I. is to verify the same and get the Sale Deed executed within the limitation period, and further, there is no attestation of in the attached AOS, hence, it is advisable for F.I. to obtain Revised AOS including Signatures of the Witnesses in the said deed or proceed as per its internal policies. 9. Thus, once a Sale Deed is executed by the said 1. Merugu Prakash Rao, 2.Merugu Navya & 3. Merugu Nikhilesh in favour of the applicant in pursuant to the above Agreement of Sale, the said Garikipati Neeharika, will become the owner of the property admeasuring an extent of 41 Sq. Yds., bearing house number 19-674, in Falt No. SF-2, plot.no. 21, comprised in survey number's 19/2A, 19/3A, 20/3, and 20/5A situated in Kanuru Village. [Pledging Deed – To be Executed] (B) Additional Documents Supporting the Title : 1. The Property Tax receipt dated 22/Jul/2024, imprinted by the YSR Tadigadapa Municipality, discloses that Merugu Manjulatha, has paid property tax for the period 2023-2025, towards house number 19-674. Note:The attached Property tax receipt stands in the name of Merugu Manjulatha swamy who deceased on 29/May/2023, But the property tax still stands in the name of deceased Merugu Manjulatha swamy. It is therefore advisable for the F.I. to verify the same. 2. Encumbrance Certificate vide Statement No. No.139846199, dated 29/Jan/2026, extracted for the with respect to the Schedule Property have been provided. We confirm that the said certificate does not reflect any adverse entries. Note: It is to be noted that the pledging deed is not reflected in the Encumbrance Certificate (EC) with respect to the Survey Number. Hence, F.I. to verify the same and may proceed as per internal policy process.

sections.content: Note:: It is to be noted that the online EC has been verified using the key parameters, namely the Document Number, Survey Number/House Number, and Split Survey/House Number of the concerned SRO, as per the Deed. However, cross-verification across multiple SROs has not been carried out due to the AP portal’s requirement of separate passwords for each search parameter, and the OTP-based authentication mechanism makes searches across multiple SROs operationally infeasible.

We have reviewed the documents provided to us as per the F.I. policy and have concluded that the 1. Merugu Prakash Rao, 2. Merugu Navya and 3. Merugu Nikhilesh holds the right to execute the Sale Deed in favour of  Garikipati Neeharika towards 41 Sq. Yds., with a plinth area of 675.00 square feet, together with 100.0 square feet of common area and 23.0 square feet of parking area, comprised in Re-Survey Nos. 19/2A, 19/3A, 20/3 and 20/5A, revised as L.P. No. 354/80 and subsequently revised as L.P. No. 7/81, bearing House number 19-674 in Flat No. SF-2, situated on the Second Floor of the RCC residential apartment complex known as “Shri Maruti Enclave,” consisting of Ground, First and Second Floors, constructed on the land described in the A-Schedule, located at Kanuru Gram Panchayat Area and Kanuru Village, within Vijayawada Registration District, Krishna District, and within the jurisdiction of the Sub-Registrar Office. And, the prospective purchaser, Garikipati Neeharika will get the right, title, and interest over the schedule property upon execution of the Registered Sale Deed in his favour by the current owner 1. Merugu Prakash Rao, 2. Merugu Navya and 3. Merugu Nikhilesh, subject to discharge of active mortgage vide doc.no. 1796 of 2011.
